## Using SyRF

## R 

R is a programming language we use day-to-day in CAMARADES to develop evidence synthesis pipelines, automate steps of the review process, and to perform analyses. 

 `r fa("mug-hot")` [Get started with R](https://rstudio-education.github.io/hopr/starting.html)

 `r fa("toolbox")` [Download R](https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/#download)

 `r fa("graduation-cap")` [Download Swirl](https://swirlstats.com/students.html)- an interactive intro course that also goes through the steps of installing R and RStudio. 

 `r fa("video")` Improve your workflow for reproducible science [weblecture](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JA-vLsN-sic) (1hr, 51m) - an intro to using R reproducibly by using tools like RMarkdown, Git and GitHub 

 `r fa("book-open")` Online [book](https://r4ds.had.co.nz/) - using R for Data Science
 
 `r fa("toolbox")` RStudio [cheatsheets](https://www.rstudio.com/resources/cheatsheets/)

 `r fa("toolbox")` [Tidyverse](https://www.tidyverse.org/): collection of R packages for data science  
 
 `r fa("book-open")` Online [book](https://bookdown.org/yihui/rmarkdown/) - use R Markdown to weave narrative text and code and produce parameterised/reproducible documents (html/pdf/word).

 `r fa("toolbox")` [R Shiny](https://mastering-shiny.org/) : create interactive web applications using R  

 `r fa("toolbox")` [Git/Github](https://happygitwithr.com/) -learn about version control using Git and Github
